intro: Phelloderma cuneato-ovata, commonly known as the narrow-ovate phelloderma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its narrow, ovate-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with woody stems and aromatic foliage. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native region.
